New Records: Paolo Banchero finished with 34 points, seven rebounds, and three assists in his first game back from injury, shooting 11-of-21 from the field and 5-of-8 from three.
Key Match Events: Paolo Banchero's stirring comeback performance, Banchero's first shot was a three from the left wing that was short, Banchero forced a miss from Giannis Antetokounmpo, Banchero's first bucket was a top-of-the-key three off the dribble, Banchero's takeover in his first game showed that when his Magic teammates get healthy, Orlando can threaten the top echelon of the league.
Pre-Game Insights: The clearance to play remained a secret until a couple of hours before tipoff, Banchero was under a minutes restriction, Banchero's teammates and coaches were excited to see him play.
Post-Match Reflections: Paolo Banchero said he didn't feel like his full self, he had a couple of moments where he wanted to dunk but his legs didn't give him the boost he needed, Magic coach Jamahl Mosley said he didn't see Banchero's performance coming, Bucks coach Doc Rivers said it was unbelievable by Banchero.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Paolo Banchero received a loud ovation when he was introduced, the game was a back-to-back for both teams, the Bucks' victory required 70 combined points from Antetokounmpo and Lillard.
Others: The game was a test for the Magic's depth and Paolo Banchero's ability to lead the team without other key players, the Magic's 22-year-old cornerstone and his bankable 30 points, nine rebounds, and a half-dozen assists were a key factor in the game.
